verses.kjv: Now upon the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared, and certain others with them.
verses.web: But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they and some others came to the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared.
verses.ct: Very early on Sunday morning, the women went to the tomb, bringing the spices they had prepared. Several others came with them.

verses.kjv: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.
verses.web: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
verses.ct: When they arrived, they found the stone had been rolled away from the entrance.

verses.kjv: And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.web: They entered in, and didn’t find the Lord Jesus’ body.
verses.ct: They went inside, but the body of the Lord Jesus was not there.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:
verses.web: While they were greatly perplexed about this, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing.
verses.ct: While they stood there, completely baffled, two men suddenly appeared beside them, dressed in clothes that blazed with light.

verses.kjv: And as they were afraid, and bowed down their faces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?
verses.web: Becoming terrified, they bowed their faces down to the earth. They said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?
verses.ct: The women were terrified and dropped their faces to the ground. The men said to them, "Why are you looking for the living among the dead?

verses.kjv: He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,
verses.web: He isn’t here, but is risen. Remember what he told you when he was still in Galilee,
verses.ct: He isn't here — he has risen! Remember what he told you while he was still in Galilee:

verses.kjv: Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.
verses.web: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men and be crucified, and the third day rise again?”
verses.ct: that the Son of Man had to be handed over to sinful men, be crucified, and rise again on the 3rd day."

verses.kjv: And they remembered his words,
verses.web: They remembered his words,
verses.ct: Then they remembered his words.

verses.kjv: And returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all the rest.
verses.web: returned from the tomb, and told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
verses.ct: They hurried back from the tomb and reported everything to the 11 apostles and everyone else who was with them.

verses.kjv: It was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary the mother of James, and other women that were with them, which told these things unto the apostles.
verses.web: Now they were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and Mary the mother of James. The other women with them told these things to the apostles.
verses.ct: The women who told the apostles were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and several others who had gone with them.

verses.kjv: And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.
verses.web: These words seemed to them to be nonsense, and they didn’t believe them.
verses.ct: But the apostles thought it was nonsense and didn't believe them.

verses.kjv: Then arose Peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stooping down, he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed, wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.
verses.web: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Stooping and looking in, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he departed to his home, wondering what had happened.
verses.ct: Peter, however, jumped up and ran to the tomb. He bent down and looked inside, but all he saw were the linen burial cloths lying by themselves. He went home, stunned and wondering what had happened.

verses.kjv: And, behold, two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs.
verses.web: Behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was sixty stadia from Jerusalem.
verses.ct: That same day, 2 of the followers were walking to a village called Emmaus, about 60 stadia from Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.
verses.web: They talked with each other about all of these things which had happened.
verses.ct: They were deep in conversation about everything that had happened.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, while they communed together and reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.
verses.web: While they talked and questioned together, Jesus himself came near, and went with them.
verses.ct: As they talked and debated back and forth, Jesus himself came up and began walking alongside them.

verses.kjv: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.
verses.web: But their eyes were kept from recognizing him.
verses.ct: But something kept their eyes from recognizing him.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and are sad?
verses.web: He said to them, “What are you talking about as you walk, and are sad?”
verses.ct: He asked them, "What are you two discussing so seriously as you walk?" They stopped, their faces heavy with sadness.

verses.kjv: And the one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which are come to pass there in these days?
verses.web: One of them, named Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things which have happened there in these days?”
verses.ct: One of them, named Cleopas, replied, "Are you the only visitor in Jerusalem who hasn't heard about what's happened there these past few days?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What things? And they said unto him, Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people:
verses.web: He said to them, “What things?” They said to him, “The things concerning Jesus, the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people;
verses.ct: "What things?" he asked. They said, "About Jesus of Nazareth. He was a prophet who did incredible things and spoke with great power before God and all the people.

verses.kjv: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death, and have crucified him.
verses.web: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him.
verses.ct: But our chief priests and rulers handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him.

verses.kjv: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel: and beside all this, to day is the third day since these things were done.
verses.web: But we were hoping that it was he who would redeem Israel. Yes, and besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened.
verses.ct: We had hoped he was the one who would redeem Israel. On top of all that, today is the 3rd day since it happened.

verses.kjv: Yea, and certain women also of our company made us astonished, which were early at the sepulchre;
verses.web: Also, certain women of our company amazed us, having arrived early at the tomb;
verses.ct: Then some women from our group shocked us. They went to the tomb early this morning,

verses.kjv: And when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, which said that he was alive.
verses.web: and when they didn’t find his body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.
verses.ct: and when they didn't find his body, they came back saying they had seen a vision of angels who told them he was alive.

verses.kjv: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre, and found it even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.
verses.web: Some of us went to the tomb, and found it just like the women had said, but they didn’t see him.”
verses.ct: Some of our people went to the tomb and found it exactly as the women described — but they didn't see him."

verses.kjv: Then he said unto them, O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken:
verses.web: He said to them, “Foolish men, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "How foolish you are! How slow your hearts are to believe everything the prophets spoke about!

verses.kjv: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into his glory?
verses.web: Didn’t the Christ have to suffer these things and to enter into his glory?”
verses.ct: Didn't the Christ have to suffer all these things before entering into his glory?"

verses.kjv: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.
verses.web: Beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.
verses.ct: Then, starting with Moses and working through all the prophets, he explained to them everything in the Scriptures that pointed to himself.

verses.kjv: And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and he made as though he would have gone further.
verses.web: They came near to the village where they were going, and he acted like he would go further.
verses.ct: As they approached the village where they were headed, Jesus acted as if he were going to continue on.

verses.kjv: But they constrained him, saying, Abide with us: for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent. And he went in to tarry with them.
verses.web: They urged him, saying, “Stay with us, for it is almost evening, and the day is almost over.” He went in to stay with them.
verses.ct: But they urged him, "Stay with us — it's almost evening and the day is nearly over." So he went inside to stay with them.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he sat at meat with them, he took bread, and blessed it, and brake, and gave to them.
verses.web: When he had sat down at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks. Breaking it, he gave it to them.
verses.ct: When he sat down to eat with them, he took the bread, gave thanks, broke it, and handed it to them.

verses.kjv: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.
verses.web: Their eyes were opened and they recognized him, then he vanished out of their sight.
verses.ct: In that moment, their eyes were opened and they recognized him — and then he vanished from their sight.

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, Did not our heart burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and while he opened to us the scriptures?
verses.web: They said to one another, “Weren’t our hearts burning within us, while he spoke to us along the way, and while he opened the Scriptures to us?”
verses.ct: They looked at each other and said, "Weren't our hearts burning inside us while he talked with us on the road and opened the Scriptures to us?"

verses.kjv: And they rose up the same hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,
verses.web: They rose up that very hour, returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and those who were with them,
verses.ct: They got up immediately and rushed back to Jerusalem, where they found the 11 and the others gathered together.

verses.kjv: Saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.
verses.web: saying, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”
verses.ct: Everyone was saying, "It's true! The Lord really has risen! He appeared to Simon!"

verses.kjv: And they told what things were done in the way, and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.
verses.web: They related the things that happened along the way, and how he was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.
verses.ct: Then the 2 told their story — what had happened on the road and how they recognized Jesus when he broke the bread.

verses.kjv: And as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.
verses.web: As they said these things, Jesus himself stood among them, and said to them, “Peace be to you.”
verses.ct: While they were still talking about this, Jesus himself stood right there among them and said, "Peace be to you."

verses.kjv: But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
verses.web: But they were terrified and filled with fear, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
verses.ct: They were terrified and panic-stricken, thinking they were seeing a spirit.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?
verses.web: He said to them, “Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?
verses.ct: He said to them, "Why are you so shaken? Why do doubts fill your hearts?

verses.kjv: Behold my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.
verses.web: See my hands and my feet, that it is truly me. Touch me and see, for a spirit doesn’t have flesh and bones, as you see that I have.”
verses.ct: Look at my hands and my feet — it's really me. Touch me and see for yourselves. A spirit doesn't have flesh and bones like I do."

verses.kjv: And when he had thus spoken, he shewed them his hands and his feet.
verses.web: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
verses.ct: As he said this, he held out his hands and showed them his feet.

verses.kjv: And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he said unto them, Have ye here any meat?
verses.web: While they still didn’t believe for joy, and wondered, he said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
verses.ct: They still couldn't believe it — not because they doubted, but because the joy was too overwhelming. So he asked them, "Do you have anything here to eat?"

verses.kjv: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.
verses.web: They gave him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb.
verses.ct: They gave him a piece of broiled fish and some honeycomb.

verses.kjv: And he took it, and did eat before them.
verses.web: He took them, and ate in front of them.
verses.ct: He took it and ate it right in front of them.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, These are the words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, and in the prophets, and in the psalms, concerning me.
verses.web: He said to them, “This is what I told you, while I was still with you, that all things which are written in the law of Moses, the prophets, and the psalms, concerning me must be fulfilled.”
verses.ct: Then he told them, "This is what I was telling you while I was still with you: everything written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets, and the Psalms must be fulfilled."

verses.kjv: Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures,
verses.web: Then he opened their minds, that they might understand the Scriptures.
verses.ct: Then he opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:
verses.web: He said to them, “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,
verses.ct: He said to them, "This is what was written: the Christ would suffer and rise from the dead on the 3rd day,

verses.kjv: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.web: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name to all the nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: and repentance and the forgiveness of sins would be proclaimed in his name to all nations, starting from Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And ye are witnesses of these things.
verses.web: You are witnesses of these things.
verses.ct: You are witnesses of all these things.

verses.kjv: And, behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high.
verses.web: Behold, I send out the promise of my Father on you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high.”
verses.ct: Now listen — I am sending you what my Father promised. But stay here in Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high."

verses.kjv: And he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
verses.web: He led them out as far as Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
verses.ct: Then he led them out to the area near Bethany. He raised his hands and blessed them.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted from them, and carried up into heaven.
verses.web: While he blessed them, he withdrew from them, and was carried up into heaven.
verses.ct: While he was blessing them, he was taken from them and carried up into heaven.

verses.kjv: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:
verses.web: They worshiped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
verses.ct: They worshiped him, then returned to Jerusalem overflowing with joy.

verses.kjv: And were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
verses.web: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
verses.ct: They spent their time continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
